sunnah_details.miswak.what: Cleaning the mouth with a special stick from the arak root.
sunnah_details.miswak.history: Miswak was a crucial practice in the Prophet's ﷺ life; he used it upon waking up, before ablution, prayer, and entering the house.
sunnah_details.miswak.why: The Prophet ﷺ said it is a purification for the mouth and a means of gaining the pleasure of the Lord.
sunnah_details.miswak.spiritual: Following the Sunnah of the Prophet ﷺ, elevating the status of the prayer, purifying the soul and body before standing before Allah.
sunnah_details.miswak.health: Strengthens gums, kills harmful bacteria in the mouth, eliminates bad breath, and prevents tooth decay.
sunnah_details.miswak.hadith: «If I had not found it difficult for my followers, I would have ordered them to clean their teeth with Siwak for every prayer» (Bukhari).
sunnah_details.morning_dua.what: Supplication recited immediately after waking up from sleep.
sunnah_details.morning_dua.history: This dua was a constant practice of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ every time he opened his eyes to a new day.
sunnah_details.morning_dua.why: Sleep from an Islamic perspective is akin to a 'minor death'. Waking up is a great mercy from Allah that requires gratitude.
sunnah_details.morning_dua.spiritual: Recognizing that life and death (even temporary) are in the hands of the Creator. It sets a spiritual tone from the first second of the day.
sunnah_details.morning_dua.hadith: «Praise is to Allah Who gives us life after He has caused us to die and unto Him is the return» (Bukhari).
sunnah_details.fajr_sunnah.what: Two short rakaats of sunnah prayer before the obligatory morning Fajr prayer.
sunnah_details.fajr_sunnah.history: Aisha reported that the Prophet ﷺ did not strictly adhere to any voluntary prayers as much as he did to this one.
sunnah_details.fajr_sunnah.why: Fajr prayer is the hardest time to wake up. These two rakaats serve as a highly valuable reward for the believer.
sunnah_details.fajr_sunnah.spiritual: These 2 rakaats are better than this world and everything in it. They protect from hypocrisy on this day.
sunnah_details.fajr_sunnah.hadith: «The two rakaats of Fajr are better than this world and what it contains» (Muslim, 725).
sunnah_details.rawatib.what: Voluntary 12 rakaats per day, which are attached to the obligatory (fard) prayers.
sunnah_details.rawatib.history: Companions noted the Prophet's ﷺ strict consistency in offering them: 2 before fajr, 4 before dhuhr and 2 after, 2 after maghrib, 2 after isha.
sunnah_details.rawatib.why: Sunnah rawatib correct and cover up shortcomings made by a person in obligatory prayers.
sunnah_details.rawatib.spiritual: Builds a house in Paradise. Creates a protective vacuum for the most important pillar of faith — prayer.
sunnah_details.rawatib.hadith: «He who prays twelve rakaats a day and night, Allah will build a house for him in Paradise» (Muslim, 728).
sunnah_details.mosque.what: Leaving the house in a state of ablution and walking to the mosque for congregational prayer.
sunnah_details.mosque.history: During the era of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, all Muslims (except the sick) always gathered in the mosque 5 times a day.
sunnah_details.mosque.why: Footsteps wipe away sins and elevate the status of the believer in the hierarchy of the righteous.
sunnah_details.mosque.spiritual: Congregational prayer is 27 times superior to individual prayer. Walking steps to the mosque are among the heaviest rewards on the scales.
sunnah_details.mosque.health: Physical activity at least 5 times a day, improvement of the circulatory and cardiovascular system.
sunnah_details.mosque.hadith: «Indeed, the greatest reward for prayer awaits the one who had to walk the farthest» (Muslim).
sunnah_details.post_prayer_dhikr.what: Special words of remembrance of Allah, recited immediately after the obligatory (fard) prayer.
sunnah_details.post_prayer_dhikr.history: The Prophet ﷺ taught this dhikr to the poor of Madinah so that they could outpace the wealthy Muslims in reward.
sunnah_details.post_prayer_dhikr.why: To cleanse sins even if they are like the foam of the sea, to secure the completion of prayer with the right mindset.
sunnah_details.post_prayer_dhikr.spiritu: Fills the scale of deeds with light. Brings peace and a sense of security until the next prayer.
sunnah_details.post_prayer_dhikr.health: Psychological unloading, stabilization of breathing and pulse after movements in prayer.
sunnah_details.post_prayer_dhikr.hadith: «Whoever recites [this dhikr] after every prayer, his sins will be forgiven, even if they are as abundant as the foam of the sea» (Muslim).
sunnah_details.wudu_sleep.what: Performing minor ablution (wudu) just before going to bed.
sunnah_details.wudu_sleep.history: Companions were commanded to maintain a state of perfect ritual purity, especially before sleep.
sunnah_details.wudu_sleep.why: Protection from evil. For the one who sleeps with ablution, an angel makes dua for him all night.
sunnah_details.wudu_sleep.spiritual: If a person dies in their sleep (sleep is a minor death), they die upon their innate faith (fitrah) and in a state of purity.
sunnah_details.wudu_sleep.health: Proven relaxation: water relieves physical fatigue and stress from the past day.
sunnah_details.wudu_sleep.hadith: «Whenever you intend to go to bed, perform ablution like that for the prayer...» (Al-Bukhari).
sunnah_details.ayat_kursi.what: Recitation of the greatest verse of the Quran (Al-Baqarah, verse 255) when preparing for sleep.
sunnah_details.ayat_kursi.history: Once Satan himself, caught by Abu Huraira, taught him this rule in the hope of being saved, and the Prophet ﷺ confirmed this.
sunnah_details.ayat_kursi.why: Infallible protection from any kind of satans and jinns for the whole upcoming night.
sunnah_details.ayat_kursi.spiritual: The believer receives a strong guardian angel from the Lord of the worlds. Grants true peace and reliance.
sunnah_details.ayat_kursi.health: Relieves nightmares, panic moods, and insomnia.
sunnah_details.ayat_kursi.hadith: «There will remain with you a guardian from Allah, and Satan will not approach you until morning» (Al-Bukhari).
sunnah_details.right_side.what: Sleeping position — on the right side, placing the right palm under the cheek.
sunnah_details.right_side.history: An absolute constant and uninterrupted habit of the noble Messenger of Allah ﷺ.
sunnah_details.right_side.why: Respect for the right side, protection of organs, and better physiology for sleep.
sunnah_details.right_side.spiritual: It is a physiological manifestation of Sunnah. Forms discipline even when a person is sleeping.
sunnah_details.right_side.health: Medically proven that sleeping on the left side compresses the heart. On the right — the stomach is freed, the heart and lungs function perfectly.
sunnah_details.right_side.hadith: «Then lay down on your right side and say...» (Al-Bukhari, Muslim).
sunnah_details.smile.what: Sincere smile to people on the street and household members, regardless of external circumstances.
sunnah_details.smile.history: Companions confess that they have never seen anyone who smiled more than Muhammad ﷺ.
sunnah_details.smile.why: A smile erases hostility, relieves the interlocutor's aggression, unifies hearts between believers of different tribes.
sunnah_details.smile.spiritual: Smiling at a brother is charity (sadaqah). It is recorded on the scale of good deeds just like spent wealth!
sunnah_details.smile.health: Lowers heart rate, improves mood, releases dopamine and serotonin.
sunnah_details.smile.hadith: «Your smiling in the face of your brother is charity!» (At-Tirmidhi).
sunnah_details.patience.what: Patience (sabr) — resilience to bear all difficulties without complaining to anyone except Allah.
sunnah_details.patience.history: Prophets of the Almighty were subjected to the most severe tests in history, setting a great example of sabr.
sunnah_details.patience.why: Calamities cleanse the believer. Showing patience at the very beginning of a shock demonstrates the degree of faith (Iman).
sunnah_details.patience.spiritual: Limitless reward: 'Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account' (Quran 39:10).
sunnah_details.patience.health: Immediate acceptance of a negative reality protects from nervous breakdowns, depressions, and heart attacks.
sunnah_details.patience.hadith: «True patience (Sabr) is at the first stroke of a calamity» (Al-Bukhari).
sunnah_details.kindness.what: Care, respect, and help to those who live in your neighborhood.
sunnah_details.kindness.history: In Islamic society, the status of a neighbor was equivalent in importance to distant relatives.
sunnah_details.kindness.why: Allah strictly obliged to protect neighbors. Protecting their honor, helping with food and silence is the duty of every Muslim.
sunnah_details.kindness.spiritual: The one whose neighbor is not safe from his evil will not enter Paradise, according to hadiths.
sunnah_details.kindness.health: Forms a strong, safe, and psychologically healthy utopian society.
sunnah_details.kindness.hadith: «Jibril kept recommending me to treat my neighbor well until I thought he would make him my heir» (Al-Bukhari).
